blog.name: pendantstyles
blog.title: you bring me home
blog.description:
hannah | vision isn’t 20/20, but harry is!!

+ requests are always open! +

masterlist

summary: BUT you not wearing a bra for the first time when going out for dinner with friends maybe? And possessive!Harry is so turned on...
question: BUT you not wearing a bra for the first time when going out for dinner with friends maybe? And possessive!Harry is so turned on by the sight of you but also worries about that one friend that seems to like you? So he shows a little bit more affection towards you that night, so nobody gets any ideas 👀
answer: harry :) would :) leave :) a :) love bite :) in :) public :) and kiss you more desperatedly and tenderly :) just :) because :)

tonnes and tonnes of love xx

newest story

twitter

summary: B L O G M A S 2018 , D A Y O N E
title: B L O G M A S 2018 , D A Y O N E
body:
BLOGMAS 2018, DAY ONE

hello, my loves! i am so excited to finally start Blogmas 2018! i have quite a few prompts planned out until Christmas Eve and Christmas, and i am so excited to share with you.

i hope you enjoy our first story of the month.

feedback, suggestions, ideas, comments are all welcomed into my inbox.

today’s story is based off of this video.

also! i know that the apple music festival was in september, and the missus and harry aren’t engaged until december, but we’ll fudge the timeline a bit and pretend the festival is about a week after they’ve gotten engaged.

i love you all loads.
caitlin x

Harry is unsure about your decision; he would love to have you at his performance, he would love to have you there, singing and dancing along, his eyes drawn to you as he sings your favourite solos and songs, but he did know that he would be asked questions and teased about solos and lyrics he’s written for their singles that he didn’t particularly want you to have to listen to – you had only gotten engaged two weeks ago and you very well could say you didn’t want to be with him anymore (you could reiterate to him how much you love him a million times, but you knew that he would have that subconscious fear until the day you say ‘I Do’).

He wanted to simply do his performance – afterwards, he would be with you, have Christmas with his family, and celebrate the New Year with you – your first New Year’s together, in a relationship and engaged – and following Christmas, you would be in America for two months fully to plan your wedding.

He didn’t want the distractions that this performance would bring with the interviews.

“’m fine, Bub. Stop worrying about me,” you insist, wrapping your arms around his shoulders, your fingertips laced together at the nape of his neck, playing with the curled baby hairs that fall out his bun. “Sing your heart out, and I’ll be grand.”

“James is going to ask about ‘Perfect’, most likely, and ‘m not sure what else,” he sighs, his eyes fluttering closed as you kiss his forehead, “but, y’a know if you get uncomfortable with anything, you can leave and not stay out there – I won’t be bothered.”

“Harry, I’m not leaving an interview because James is going to talk about a lyric that you wrote, b’fore I met you,” you assure, shaking your head as he purses his lips. “’m more mature than that.”

He kisses your lips gently, squeezing your hips as you wrap your arms tighter around him, his hands holding you close to his chest as he hugs you. “Can you at least promise me that if anything, you won’t leave? Gem is here and wants to see you, and I think Mum is going to meet us for dinner in the city.”

“Where on earth would I go, hm? Do I look like I know my way around London?” you scoff, wrapping your arms around him in a tight squeeze, stepping away and allows him to stand on his feet.

He straightens his jeans and patterned shirt before slinging his arm around your shoulders, your arms tucked around his waist, fingers nudged beneath his shirt and holding onto his hips as you begin to walk into the corridor, laughter and talking echoing off the walls from the kitchen, Niall’s cackle heard above everyone else.

“He couldn’t possibly be any louder, I swear,” Harry teases, manoeuvring his hold to intertwine your fingers, his palm warm against yours, his figure pushing the door open into the crowded room, his best friends gathered around the large dining tables with their girlfriends and meals scattered across the table cloth. “We could hear all the way in the dressing room, mate.”

“’s not ‘me fault,” he defends, his hand covering his mouth as he chokes on his water, “Our friends are idiots.”

“Could’ve told you that one long ago,” Harry chuckles, shaking his head as he gestures toward an empty seat on the bench, stepping away to gather water bottles and a lunch for you and himself.

“How was your flight, Y/N? Did jet lag kick in, yet?” Louis wonders, his water being gulped as he finishes his final word.

“Would you call falling asleep at half nine last night and waking up at nine this morning jet lag?” you laugh, yawning as you nod a ‘thank you’ to your boyfriend as he settles in his seat beside you. “Because, if you do, then hell yes jet lag has kicked in.”

“Sleeping at half nine,” Liam emphasises, his eyes widening and eyebrows raising as he reiterates your sentence. “Has to be a new jet lag record.”

“She fell asleep on the plane! Grump, she was, when we had to wake her up once we landed,” Harry teases, kissing your cheek as you roll your eyes, his hand squeezing your thigh lovingly as you squint at him. “Y/N is getting used to the travelling, though. She’s only travelled home with me, twice, right? We went to an old friend from Chapel’s wedding in April and you met my family for the first time, and now, you’re here, we’re here, until January.”

“Did you tell your family about the engagement, yet?” Sophia smiles, her torso moving forward to face you, her hand reaching out to admire your ring, a perfect fit with a diamond settled comfortably on your finger. “Harry, your mum is going to be so happy.”

“Haven’t told anyone yet. We told Y/N’s family on Christmas Eve, and we’re telling my family on New Year’s. Hopefully Gem doesn’t find out before then, because she’ll spoil everything.”

“Gemma? No. She wouldn’t say anything,” you assure, pouting your bottom lip as you think carefully about his sister’s reaction to your announcement. “Don’t think she would, anyways.”

“She will be too excited to not tell our mother. ‘m sure of it.”

“Have to hide my ring, then, when ‘m seated with her during the performance.”

“Guess so,” he shrugs, his lips curving into a smirk as he kisses your hair.

He would have to admit, he loved having your engagement as a secret. He loved having a moment with you that he didn’t have to share with everyone, just yet. He, obviously, wants to tell his mother – she will be ecstatic – but he wanted to have your moment to absorb your engagement privately, before everyone would be wondering about every detail of your wedding day.

He only wanted your engagement to be yours – and you didn’t mind that, either.

+ +

Gemma embraces you tightly as you step onto the platform where you would be sitting. With a perfect view of the stage and your fiancé able to spot you in the crowd, you couldn’t have hoped for a better experience. She has a bright smile on her face, her date standing nervously to greet you, a smirk building on your features as you wink, her cheeks blushing pink as you laugh quietly. She is one of your favourite people that you have ever met – truly one of the most kind, caring, loving individuals that has been introduced into your life, and knowing that she would be your sister in only a short four months made you very excited.

“Hello, hello! Oh, I’ve missed you. ‘m thinking I’ll have to sneak you away from my brother for a day date before your off on your way home – we have so much to talk about,” she grins, hugging you with a squeeze, her hands holding yours as she smiles. “Oh! Y/N, this is Michal, Michal, this is Y/N. She and Harry have been dating for nearly a year, now. We’re all waiting for him to propose, y’a know. ‘m sure my mum will be nagging him about marrying you as soon as you step inside; she’s been waiting since Day One.”

“Very nice to meet you, Michal. Oh, and have I mentioned how much I love your mother,” you giggle, your heart pounding wildly as your ring nudges against your palm – you forgot to take it off. “We’re driving into Chapel on New Year’s Eve. We can have lunch any day. Harry will have to deal with a date, he can preoccupy himself for the day.”

“He’s a baby,” she mocks, shaking her head as you settle in your seat, herself and Michal sitting comfortably, her words quieting as the stage lights begin to dim and James steps on stage. “He’ll complain, but ‘m still doing it.”

“We will definitely go out,” you assure, smiling widely as your ears perk to Harry’s name. “Don’t worry about a thing.”

Harry steps onto the stage confidently, his best friends set in their designated spots, with the microphones securely in place and ready to be used. Harry sees you instantly, his green eyes lighting up with your presence, his cheeks blushing pink as you blow him a kiss encouragingly.

He sings his heart out. His passion and love for his career shining, his melodic voice bringing tears to your eyes – you couldn’t have been more proud of him. He could be humming in the shower, or as he mindless prepares dinner in your kitchen; you were so proud.

His figure fidgets nervously on the couch once their interview with James begins, his anxiousness unseen to the audience and his best friends, but you could see his nerves in his eyes. He was worried about the questions, about the comments, about the possibilities of what could be upsetting to you – because the last thing he would want if for you to be hurt by words that were said carelessly.

James smirks as he begins his next segment of the interview, and Harry knows exactly where he’s going with it. His cheeks blush nervously as he blinks – of course, James would have to touch on his lyrics; why would he not?

“So, I’m reading the lyrics and I happen upon a line, and in this line it says, ‘… and if you’re looking to find someone to write your break up songs about, baby, I’m perfect.’ Now listen, I don’t wan’a have any ‘Bad Blood’ about this, and if this is a problem, we don’t have to talk about it and we can just ‘Shake It Off’.” James pauses, Niall’s laughter echoing around the room, Harry’s fingertips pinching his features as he blushes a shade of pink and smirks. “Who’s the song about?”

Harry laughs, shaking his head as he begins his smooth response, “Um, I think the thing with song writing is that, everybody writes from personal experience, y’a know? It’s not always necessarily what it sounds like it’s about.”

“Isn’t it?” James chimes, the audience’s laughter making you smile.

“Sometimes, sometimes it is! I think it’s up for, uh, it’s open to interpretation of what anyone thinks it’s about.”

“Swiftly dealt with,” James retorts, Harry’s smirk making your cheeks ache with a smile.

His final performance, his final song of the day is wonderful. With the audience singing and dancing along, you could see how happy his career made him, how much he loved being on stage and singing to hundreds and thousands of people – of individuals and an undeniable, loving fanbase who love and adore him as much as he would love and adore each and every one of them.

Words couldn’t possibly describe how proud you were of him, how much you loved him.

Gemma smiles as you talk about your lunch date that would be occurring the following afternoon, your excitement exhibited on your features as you think of dining and boutiques that would be taking your money as you have a walk through downtown – a favourite destination you couldn’t visit often but loved so much. Becoming a part of Harry’s family meant becoming friendly with the people that meant the most to him – and you were incredibly grateful and felt so loved by everyone, especially Gemma; she had become one of your best friends in the quaint amount of time you had known her, truly gotten to know her, and hiding that you were engaged and getting married to her baby brother in less than six months was eating away at your stomach.

New Year’s Eve felt like a light-year away.

Harry bumbles into the dressing room, a smile perked on his lips as he wraps his arms around your waist, lifting you lightly off your feet, kissing your lips as you cup his palms in your hands. His eyebrows furrow together in confusion as he hears a gasp at the entrance of the room, his eyes widening as he notices his older sister’s narrowed vision on your finger, your engagement ring glimmering beneath the fluorescent lights.

“Harry, I knew it!” she grins, stepping inside and reaching for your hand, her fingertip tracing of the diamond delicately. “Ugh, I’m mad at you for not telling me, but I am too excited to show that, right now.” She embraces you tightly, rocking you in her hold as she laughs, her attention travelling between you and the engagement ring permanently marked on your finger. “Very nice choice, by the way, H. Have you told Mum, yet?”

“We haven’t told many people. We’re waiting until New Year’s Eve,” he informs, his attention focused solely on her as he wraps his arm around your shoulder, your arms tucked around his waist and you nuzzle into his side. “Gemma, if you tell Mum before we do, I am going to be so upset with you.”

“I won’t, I won’t!” she squeaks, her lips etched into a grin with excitement. “’m expecting every detail of the proposal when you tell our mother. Oh God, she is going to be over the moon. She has been waiting for this for months.”

“We’re very excited to tell her,” you smile, your eyelashes fluttering against your cheeks as Harry kisses your hair. “It’s going to be an exciting New Year’s – an exciting year – we could at least tell y’a that.”

“Sleeping at half nine,” Liam emphasises, his eyes widening and eyebrows raising as he reiterates your sentence. “Has to be a new jet lag record.”

“She fell asleep on the plane! Grump, she was, when we had to wake her up once we landed,” Harry teases, kissing your cheek as you roll your eyes, his hand squeezing your thigh lovingly as you squint at him. “Y/N is getting used to the travelling, though. She’s only travelled home with me, twice, right? We went to an old friend from Chapel’s wedding in April and you met my family for the first time, and now, you’re here, we’re here, until January.”

“Did you tell your family about the engagement, yet?” Sophia smiles, her torso moving forward to face you, her hand reaching out to admire your ring, a perfect fit with a diamond settled comfortably on your finger. “Harry, your mum is going to be so happy.”

“Haven’t told anyone yet. We told Y/N’s family on Christmas Eve, and we’re telling my family on New Year’s. Hopefully Gem doesn’t find out before then, because she’ll spoil everything.”

“Gemma? No. She wouldn’t say anything,” you assure, pouting your bottom lip as you think carefully about his sister’s reaction to your announcement. “Don’t think she would, anyways.”

“She will be too excited to not tell our mother. ‘m sure of it.”

“Have to hide my ring, then, when ‘m seated with her during the performance.”

“Guess so,” he shrugs, his lips curving into a smirk as he kisses your hair.

He would have to admit, he loved having your engagement as a secret. He loved having a moment with you that he didn’t have to share with everyone, just yet. He, obviously, wants to tell his mother – she will be ecstatic – but he wanted to have your moment to absorb your engagement privately, before everyone would be wondering about every detail of your wedding day.

He only wanted your engagement to be yours – and you didn’t mind that, either.

+ +

Gemma embraces you tightly as you step onto the platform where you would be sitting. With a perfect view of the stage and your fiancé able to spot you in the crowd, you couldn’t have hoped for a better experience. She has a bright smile on her face, her date standing nervously to greet you, a smirk building on your features as you wink, her cheeks blushing pink as you laugh quietly. She is one of your favourite people that you have ever met – truly one of the most kind, caring, loving individuals that has been introduced into your life, and knowing that she would be your sister in only a short four months made you very excited.

“Hello, hello! Oh, I’ve missed you. ‘m thinking I’ll have to sneak you away from my brother for a day date before your off on your way home – we have so much to talk about,” she grins, hugging you with a squeeze, her hands holding yours as she smiles. “Oh! Y/N, this is Michal, Michal, this is Y/N. She and Harry have been dating for nearly a year, now. We’re all waiting for him to propose, y’a know. ‘m sure my mum will be nagging him about marrying you as soon as you step inside; she’s been waiting since Day One.”

“Very nice to meet you, Michal. Oh, and have I mentioned how much I love your mother,” you giggle, your heart pounding wildly as your ring nudges against your palm – you forgot to take it off. “We’re driving into Chapel on New Year’s Eve. We can have lunch any day. Harry will have to deal with a date, he can preoccupy himself for the day.”

“He’s a baby,” she mocks, shaking her head as you settle in your seat, herself and Michal sitting comfortably, her words quieting as the stage lights begin to dim and James steps on stage. “He’ll complain, but ‘m still doing it.”

“We will definitely go out,” you assure, smiling widely as your ears perk to Harry’s name. “Don’t worry about a thing.”

Harry steps onto the stage confidently, his best friends set in their designated spots, with the microphones securely in place and ready to be used. Harry sees you instantly, his green eyes lighting up with your presence, his cheeks blushing pink as you blow him a kiss encouragingly.

He sings his heart out. His passion and love for his career shining, his melodic voice bringing tears to your eyes – you couldn’t have been more proud of him. He could be humming in the shower, or as he mindless prepares dinner in your kitchen; you were so proud.

His figure fidgets nervously on the couch once their interview with James begins, his anxiousness unseen to the audience and his best friends, but you could see his nerves in his eyes. He was worried about the questions, about the comments, about the possibilities of what could be upsetting to you – because the last thing he would want if for you to be hurt by words that were said carelessly.

James smirks as he begins his next segment of the interview, and Harry knows exactly where he’s going with it. His cheeks blush nervously as he blinks – of course, James would have to touch on his lyrics; why would he not?

“So, I’m reading the lyrics and I happen upon a line, and in this line it says, ‘… and if you’re looking to find someone to write your break up songs about, baby, I’m perfect.’ Now listen, I don’t wan’a have any ‘Bad Blood’ about this, and if this is a problem, we don’t have to talk about it and we can just ‘Shake It Off’.” James pauses, Niall’s laughter echoing around the room, Harry’s fingertips pinching his features as he blushes a shade of pink and smirks. “Who’s the song about?”

Harry laughs, shaking his head as he begins his smooth response, “Um, I think the thing with song writing is that, everybody writes from personal experience, y’a know? It’s not always necessarily what it sounds like it’s about.”

“Isn’t it?” James chimes, the audience’s laughter making you smile.

“Sometimes, sometimes it is! I think it’s up for, uh, it’s open to interpretation of what anyone thinks it’s about.”

“Swiftly dealt with,” James retorts, Harry’s smirk making your cheeks ache with a smile.

His final performance, his final song of the day is wonderful. With the audience singing and dancing along, you could see how happy his career made him, how much he loved being on stage and singing to hundreds and thousands of people – of individuals and an undeniable, loving fanbase who love and adore him as much as he would love and adore each and every one of them.

Words couldn’t possibly describe how proud you were of him, how much you loved him.

Gemma smiles as you talk about your lunch date that would be occurring the following afternoon, your excitement exhibited on your features as you think of dining and boutiques that would be taking your money as you have a walk through downtown – a favourite destination you couldn’t visit often but loved so much. Becoming a part of Harry’s family meant becoming friendly with the people that meant the most to him – and you were incredibly grateful and felt so loved by everyone, especially Gemma; she had become one of your best friends in the quaint amount of time you had known her, truly gotten to know her, and hiding that you were engaged and getting married to her baby brother in less than six months was eating away at your stomach.

New Year’s Eve felt like a light-year away.

Harry bumbles into the dressing room, a smile perked on his lips as he wraps his arms around your waist, lifting you lightly off your feet, kissing your lips as you cup his palms in your hands. His eyebrows furrow together in confusion as he hears a gasp at the entrance of the room, his eyes widening as he notices his older sister’s narrowed vision on your finger, your engagement ring glimmering beneath the fluorescent lights.

“Harry, I knew it!” she grins, stepping inside and reaching for your hand, her fingertip tracing of the diamond delicately. “Ugh, I’m mad at you for not telling me, but I am too excited to show that, right now.” She embraces you tightly, rocking you in her hold as she laughs, her attention travelling between you and the engagement ring permanently marked on your finger. “Very nice choice, by the way, H. Have you told Mum, yet?”

“We haven’t told many people. We’re waiting until New Year’s Eve,” he informs, his attention focused solely on her as he wraps his arm around your shoulder, your arms tucked around his waist and you nuzzle into his side. “Gemma, if you tell Mum before we do, I am going to be so upset with you.”

“I won’t, I won’t!” she squeaks, her lips etched into a grin with excitement. “’m expecting every detail of the proposal when you tell our mother. Oh God, she is going to be over the moon. She has been waiting for this for months.”

“We’re very excited to tell her,” you smile, your eyelashes fluttering against your cheeks as Harry kisses your hair. “It’s going to be an exciting New Year’s – an exciting year – we could at least tell y’a that.”
trail.content:
BLOGMAS 2018, DAY ONE

hello, my loves! i am so excited to finally start Blogmas 2018! i have quite a few prompts planned out until Christmas Eve and Christmas, and i am so excited to share with you.

i hope you enjoy our first story of the month.

feedback, suggestions, ideas, comments are all welcomed into my inbox.

today’s story is based off of this video.

also! i know that the apple music festival was in september, and the missus and harry aren’t engaged until december, but we’ll fudge the timeline a bit and pretend the festival is about a week after they’ve gotten engaged.

i love you all loads.
caitlin x

Harry is unsure about your decision; he would love to have you at his performance, he would love to have you there, singing and dancing along, his eyes drawn to you as he sings your favourite solos and songs, but he did know that he would be asked questions and teased about solos and lyrics he’s written for their singles that he didn’t particularly want you to have to listen to – you had only gotten engaged two weeks ago and you very well could say you didn’t want to be with him anymore (you could reiterate to him how much you love him a million times, but you knew that he would have that subconscious fear until the day you say ‘I Do’).

He wanted to simply do his performance – afterwards, he would be with you, have Christmas with his family, and celebrate the New Year with you – your first New Year’s together, in a relationship and engaged – and following Christmas, you would be in America for two months fully to plan your wedding.

He didn’t want the distractions that this performance would bring with the interviews.

“’m fine, Bub. Stop worrying about me,” you insist, wrapping your arms around his shoulders, your fingertips laced together at the nape of his neck, playing with the curled baby hairs that fall out his bun. “Sing your heart out, and I’ll be grand.”

“James is going to ask about ‘Perfect’, most likely, and ‘m not sure what else,” he sighs, his eyes fluttering closed as you kiss his forehead, “but, y’a know if you get uncomfortable with anything, you can leave and not stay out there – I won’t be bothered.”

“Harry, I’m not leaving an interview because James is going to talk about a lyric that you wrote, b’fore I met you,” you assure, shaking your head as he purses his lips. “’m more mature than that.”

He kisses your lips gently, squeezing your hips as you wrap your arms tighter around him, his hands holding you close to his chest as he hugs you. “Can you at least promise me that if anything, you won’t leave? Gem is here and wants to see you, and I think Mum is going to meet us for dinner in the city.”

“Where on earth would I go, hm? Do I look like I know my way around London?” you scoff, wrapping your arms around him in a tight squeeze, stepping away and allows him to stand on his feet.

He straightens his jeans and patterned shirt before slinging his arm around your shoulders, your arms tucked around his waist, fingers nudged beneath his shirt and holding onto his hips as you begin to walk into the corridor, laughter and talking echoing off the walls from the kitchen, Niall’s cackle heard above everyone else.

“He couldn’t possibly be any louder, I swear,” Harry teases, manoeuvring his hold to intertwine your fingers, his palm warm against yours, his figure pushing the door open into the crowded room, his best friends gathered around the large dining tables with their girlfriends and meals scattered across the table cloth. “We could hear all the way in the dressing room, mate.”

“’s not ‘me fault,” he defends, his hand covering his mouth as he chokes on his water, “Our friends are idiots.”

“Could’ve told you that one long ago,” Harry chuckles, shaking his head as he gestures toward an empty seat on the bench, stepping away to gather water bottles and a lunch for you and himself.

“How was your flight, Y/N? Did jet lag kick in, yet?” Louis wonders, his water being gulped as he finishes his final word.

“Would you call falling asleep at half nine last night and waking up at nine this morning jet lag?” you laugh, yawning as you nod a ‘thank you’ to your boyfriend as he settles in his seat beside you. “Because, if you do, then hell yes jet lag has kicked in.”

“Sleeping at half nine,” Liam emphasises, his eyes widening and eyebrows raising as he reiterates your sentence. “Has to be a new jet lag record.”

“She fell asleep on the plane! Grump, she was, when we had to wake her up once we landed,” Harry teases, kissing your cheek as you roll your eyes, his hand squeezing your thigh lovingly as you squint at him. “Y/N is getting used to the travelling, though. She’s only travelled home with me, twice, right? We went to an old friend from Chapel’s wedding in April and you met my family for the first time, and now, you’re here, we’re here, until January.”

“Did you tell your family about the engagement, yet?” Sophia smiles, her torso moving forward to face you, her hand reaching out to admire your ring, a perfect fit with a diamond settled comfortably on your finger. “Harry, your mum is going to be so happy.”

“Haven’t told anyone yet. We told Y/N’s family on Christmas Eve, and we’re telling my family on New Year’s. Hopefully Gem doesn’t find out before then, because she’ll spoil everything.”

“Gemma? No. She wouldn’t say anything,” you assure, pouting your bottom lip as you think carefully about his sister’s reaction to your announcement. “Don’t think she would, anyways.”

“She will be too excited to not tell our mother. ‘m sure of it.”

“Have to hide my ring, then, when ‘m seated with her during the performance.”

“Guess so,” he shrugs, his lips curving into a smirk as he kisses your hair.

He would have to admit, he loved having your engagement as a secret. He loved having a moment with you that he didn’t have to share with everyone, just yet. He, obviously, wants to tell his mother – she will be ecstatic – but he wanted to have your moment to absorb your engagement privately, before everyone would be wondering about every detail of your wedding day.

He only wanted your engagement to be yours – and you didn’t mind that, either.

+ +

Gemma embraces you tightly as you step onto the platform where you would be sitting. With a perfect view of the stage and your fiancé able to spot you in the crowd, you couldn’t have hoped for a better experience. She has a bright smile on her face, her date standing nervously to greet you, a smirk building on your features as you wink, her cheeks blushing pink as you laugh quietly. She is one of your favourite people that you have ever met – truly one of the most kind, caring, loving individuals that has been introduced into your life, and knowing that she would be your sister in only a short four months made you very excited.

“Hello, hello! Oh, I’ve missed you. ‘m thinking I’ll have to sneak you away from my brother for a day date before your off on your way home – we have so much to talk about,” she grins, hugging you with a squeeze, her hands holding yours as she smiles. “Oh! Y/N, this is Michal, Michal, this is Y/N. She and Harry have been dating for nearly a year, now. We’re all waiting for him to propose, y’a know. ‘m sure my mum will be nagging him about marrying you as soon as you step inside; she’s been waiting since Day One.”

“Very nice to meet you, Michal. We can have lunch any day. Harry will have to deal with a date, he can preoccupy himself for the day.”

“We will definitely go out,” you assure, smiling widely as your ears perk to Harry’s name. “Don’t worry about a thing.”

Harry steps onto the stage confidently, his best friends set in their designated spots, with the microphones securely in place and ready to be used. Harry sees you instantly, his green eyes lighting up with your presence, his cheeks blushing pink as you blow him a kiss encouragingly.

He sings his heart out. His passion and love for his career shining, his melodic voice bringing tears to your eyes – you couldn’t have been more proud of him. He could be humming in the shower, or as he mindless prepares dinner in your kitchen; you were so proud.

His figure fidgets nervously on the couch once their interview with James begins, his anxiousness unseen to the audience and his best friends, but you could see his nerves in his eyes. He was worried about the questions, about the comments, about the possibilities of what could be upsetting to you – because the last thing he would want if for you to be hurt by words that were said carelessly.

James smirks as he begins his next segment of the interview, and Harry knows exactly where he’s going with it. His cheeks blush nervously as he blinks – of course, James would have to touch on his lyrics; why would he not?

“So, I’m reading the lyrics and I happen upon a line, and in this line it says, ‘… and if you’re looking to find someone to write your break up songs about, baby, I’m perfect.’ Now listen, I don’t wan’a have any ‘Bad Blood’ about this, and if this is a problem, we don’t have to talk about it and we can just ‘Shake It Off’.” James pauses, Niall’s laughter echoing around the room, Harry’s fingertips pinching his features as he blushes a shade of pink and smirks. “Who’s the song about?”

Harry laughs, shaking his head as he begins his smooth response, “Um, I think the thing with song writing is that, everybody writes from personal experience, y’a know? It’s not always necessarily what it sounds like it’s about.”

“Isn’t it?” James chimes, the audience’s laughter making you smile.

“Sometimes, sometimes it is! I think it’s up for, uh, it’s open to interpretation of what anyone thinks it’s about.”

“Swiftly dealt with,” James retorts, Harry’s smirk making your cheeks ache with a smile.

His final performance, his final song of the day is wonderful. With the audience singing and dancing along, you could see how happy his career made him, how much he loved being on stage and singing to hundreds and thousands of people – of individuals and an undeniable, loving fanbase who love and adore him as much as he would love and adore each and every one of them.

Words couldn’t possibly describe how proud you were of him, how much you loved him.

Gemma smiles as you talk about your lunch date that would be occurring the following afternoon, your excitement exhibited on your features as you think of dining and boutiques that would be taking your money as you have a walk through downtown – a favourite destination you couldn’t visit often but loved so much. Becoming a part of Harry’s family meant becoming friendly with the people that meant the most to him – and you were incredibly grateful and felt so loved by everyone, especially Gemma; she had become one of your best friends in the quaint amount of time you had known her, truly gotten to know her, and hiding that you were engaged and getting married to her baby brother in less than six months was eating away at your stomach.

Harry bumbles into the dressing room, a smile perked on his lips as he wraps his arms around your waist, lifting you lightly off your feet, kissing your lips as you cup his palms in your hands. His eyebrows furrow together in confusion as he hears a gasp at the entrance of the room, his eyes widening as he notices his older sister’s narrowed vision on your finger, your engagement ring glimmering beneath the fluorescent lights.

“Harry, I knew it!” she grins, stepping inside and reaching for your hand, her fingertip tracing of the diamond delicately. “Ugh, I’m mad at you for not telling me, but I am too excited to show that, right now.” She embraces you tightly, rocking you in her hold as she laughs, her attention travelling between you and the engagement ring permanently marked on your finger. “Very nice choice, by the way, H. Have you told Mum, yet?”

“We haven’t told many people. We’re waiting until New Year’s Eve,” he informs, his attention focused solely on her as he wraps his arm around your shoulder, your arms tucked around his waist and you nuzzle into his side. “Gemma, if you tell Mum before we do, I am going to be so upset with you.”

“I won’t, I won’t!” she squeaks, her lips etched into a grin with excitement. “’m expecting every detail of the proposal when you tell our mother. Oh God, she is going to be over the moon. She has been waiting for this for months.”

“We’re very excited to tell her,” you smile, your eyelashes fluttering against your cheeks as Harry kisses your hair. “It’s going to be an exciting New Year’s – an exciting year – we could at least tell y’a that.”

title: Revival
body:
